vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Integer Overflow or Wraparound. APT had several integer overflows and underflows while parsing .deb packages, aka GHSL-2020-168 GHSL-2020-169, in files apt-pkg/contrib/extracttar.cc, apt-pkg/deb/debfile.cc, and apt-pkg/contrib/arfile.cc. This issue affects: apt 1.2.32ubuntu0 versions prior to 1.2.32ubuntu0.2; 1.6.12ubuntu0 versions prior to 1.6.12ubuntu0.2; 2.0.2ubuntu0 versions prior to 2.0.2ubuntu0.2; 2.1.10ubuntu0 versions prior to 2.1.10ubuntu0.1;
## Remediation
Upgrade `apt` to version  or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-27350)
- [CONFIRM](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1899193)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210108-0005/)
- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4808)
- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/usn/usn-4667-1)
vulnerabilities.name: apt/libapt-pkg5.0

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Check for Dropped Privileges
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in disable_priv_mode in shell.c in GNU Bash through 5.0 patch 11. By default, if Bash is run with its effective UID not equal to its real UID, it will drop privileges by setting its effective UID to its real UID. However, it does so incorrectly. On Linux and other systems that support "saved UID" functionality, the saved UID is not dropped. An attacker with command execution in the shell can use "enable -f" for runtime loading of a new builtin, which can be a shared object that calls setuid() and therefore regains privileges. However, binaries running with an effective UID of 0 are unaffected.

## References
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200430-0003/)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-18276)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/bminor/bash/commit/951bdaad7a18cc0dc1036bba86b18b90874d39ff)
- [MISC](http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/155498/Bash-5.0-Patch-11-Privilege-Escalation.html)
- [MISC](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-wGtxJ8opa8)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-18276)
vulnerabilities.name: bash

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
chroot in GNU coreutils, when used with --userspec, allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-2781)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/02/28/2)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2016/02/28/3)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-2781)
vulnerabilities.name: coreutils

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Write curl 7.21.0 to and including 7.73.0 is vulnerable to uncontrolled recursion due to a stack overflow issue in FTP wildcard match parsing.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version  or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-8285)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210122-0007/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/DAEHE2S2QLO4AO4MEEYL75NB7SAH5PSL/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/NZUVSQHN2ESHMJXNQ2Z7T2EELBB5HJXG/)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202012-14)
- [MISC](https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2020-8285.html)
- [MISC](https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/6255)
- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1045844)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/12/msg00029.html)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Certificate Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Certificate Validation curl 7.41.0 through 7.73.0 is vulnerable to an improper check for certificate revocation due to insufficient verification of the OCSP response.
## Remediation

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Information Exposure. A malicious server can use the FTP PASV response to trick curl 7.73.0 and earlier into connecting back to a given IP address and port, and this way potentially make curl extract information about services that are otherwise private and not disclosed, for example doing port scanning and service banner extractions.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version  or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-8284)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210122-0007/)

- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1040166)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/12/msg00029.html)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Information Exposure. Arm Armv8-A core implementations utilizing speculative execution past unconditional changes in control flow may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis, aka "straight-line speculation."
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `gcc-8`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13844)
- [CONFIRM](http://lists.llvm.org/pipermail/llvm-dev/2020-June/142109.html)
- [CONFIRM](https://developer.arm.com/support/arm-security-updates/speculative-processor-vulnerability)
- [CONFIRM](https://developer.arm.com/support/arm-security-updates/speculative-processor-vulnerability/frequently-asked-questions)
- [CONFIRM](https://gcc.gnu.org/pipermail/gcc-patches/2020-June/547520.html)
- [MISC](https://developer.arm.com/support/arm-security-updates/speculative-processor-vulnerability/downloads/straight-line-speculation)
- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-10/msg00039.html)
- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-10/msg00040.html)
vulnerabilities.name: gcc-8/libstdc++6

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2020-27618
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to CVE-2020-27618 iconv when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences fails to advance the input state, which could result in an infinite loop
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `glibc`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-27618)
vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Read. The iconv feature in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.32, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in the EUC-KR encoding, may have a buffer over-read.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `glibc`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-25013)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/4Y6TX47P47KABSFOL26FLDNVCWXDKDEZ/)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-Bounds
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.29, the memcmp function for the x32 architecture can incorrectly return zero (indicating that the inputs are equal) because the RDX most significant bit is mishandled.

## References

- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-7309)

In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.28, parse_reg_exp in posix/regcomp.c misparses alternatives, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and application exit) or trigger an incorrect result by attempting a regular-expression match.

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
In the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, the getaddrinfo function would successfully parse a string that contained an IPv4 address followed by whitespace and arbitrary characters, which could lead applications to incorrectly assume that it had parsed a valid string, without the possibility of embedded HTTP headers or other potentially dangerous substrings.

vulnerabilities.name: glibc/libc-bin

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Underflow
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Integer Underflow. An exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `glibc`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-6096)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-6096)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SPYXTDOOB4PQGTYAMZAZNJIB3FF6YQXI/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/URXOIA2LDUKHQXK4BE55BQBRI6ZZG3Y6/)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25620)
- [MISC](https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1019)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Read. The iconv feature in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.32, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in the EUC-KR encoding, may have a buffer over-read.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `glibc`.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Validation of Certificate with Host Mismatch
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Interaction between the sks-keyserver code through 1.2.0 of the SKS keyserver network, and GnuPG through 2.2.16, makes it risky to have a GnuPG keyserver configuration line referring to a host on the SKS keyserver network. Retrieving data from this network may cause a persistent denial of service, because of a Certificate Spamming Attack.

## References
- [CONFIRM](https://lists.gnupg.org/pipermail/gnupg-announce/2019q3/000439.html)
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K08654551)
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K08654551?utm_source=f5support&amp%3Butm_medium=RSS)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/AUK2YRO6QIH64WP2LRA5D4LACTXQPPU4/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/CP4ON34YEXEZDZOXXWV43KVGGO6WZLJ5/)
- [MISC](https://gist.github.com/rjhansen/67ab921ffb4084c865b3618d6955275f)
- [MISC](https://twitter.com/lambdafu/status/1147162583969009664)
- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-08/msg00039.html)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-13050)

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Interaction between the sks-keyserver code through 1.2.0 of the SKS keyserver network, and GnuPG through 2.2.16, makes it risky to have a GnuPG keyserver configuration line referring to a host on the SKS keyserver network. Retrieving data from this network may cause a persistent denial of service, because of a Certificate Spamming Attack.

## References
- [CONFIRM](https://lists.gnupg.org/pipermail/gnupg-announce/2019q3/000439.html)
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K08654551)
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K08654551?utm_source=f5support&amp%3Butm_medium=RSS)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/AUK2YRO6QIH64WP2LRA5D4LACTXQPPU4/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/CP4ON34YEXEZDZOXXWV43KVGGO6WZLJ5/)
- [MISC](https://gist.github.com/rjhansen/67ab921ffb4084c865b3618d6955275f)
- [MISC](https://twitter.com/lambdafu/status/1147162583969009664)
- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-08/msg00039.html)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-13050)

vulnerabilities.name: gnupg2/gpg-wks-server

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Validation of Certificate with Host Mismatch
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Interaction between the sks-keyserver code through 1.2.0 of the SKS keyserver network, and GnuPG through 2.2.16, makes it risky to have a GnuPG keyserver configuration line referring to a host on the SKS keyserver network. Retrieving data from this network may cause a persistent denial of service, because of a Certificate Spamming Attack.

## References
- [CONFIRM](https://lists.gnupg.org/pipermail/gnupg-announce/2019q3/000439.html)
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K08654551)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Bleichenbacher type side-channel based padding oracle attack was found in the way gnutls handles verification of RSA decrypted PKCS#1 v1.5 data. An attacker who is able to run process on the same physical core as the victim process, could use this to extract plaintext or in some cases downgrade any TLS connections to a vulnerable server.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16868)
- [MISC](http://cat.eyalro.net/)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00017.html)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00068.html)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16868)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106080)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-16868)

vulnerabilities.title: Key Management Errors
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
In the client side of Heimdal before 7.6.0, failure to verify anonymous PKINIT PA-PKINIT-KX key exchange permits a man-in-the-middle attack. This issue is in krb5_init_creds_step in lib/krb5/init_creds_pw.c.

vulnerabilities.name: heimdal/libgssapi3-heimdal

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Uncontrolled Recursion. MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17.2 and 1.18.x before 1.18.3 allows unbounded recursion via an ASN.1-encoded Kerberos message because the lib/krb5/asn.1/asn1_encode.c support for BER indefinite lengths lacks a recursion limit.
## Remediation
Upgrade `krb5` to version  or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-28196)
- [CONFIRM](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/57415dda6cf04e73ffc3723be518eddfae599bfd)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20201202-0001/)
- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4795)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/45KKOZQWIIIW5C45PJVGQ32AXBSYNBE7/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/73IGOG6CZAVMVNS4GGRMOLOZ7B6QVA7F/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/KPH2V3WSQTELROZK3GFCPQDOFLKIZ6H5/)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202011-17)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/11/msg00011.html)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/krb5-locales

vulnerabilities.title: Reachable Assertion
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20217)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20217)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/5e6d1796106df8ba6bc1973ee0917c170d929086)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20217)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/krb5-locales

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)

vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libgssapi-krb5-2

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Uncontrolled Recursion. MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17.2 and 1.18.x before 1.18.3 allows unbounded recursion via an ASN.1-encoded Kerberos message because the lib/krb5/asn.1/asn1_encode.c support for BER indefinite lengths lacks a recursion limit.
## Remediation
Upgrade `krb5` to version  or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-28196)

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable "dbentry->n_key_data" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a "u4" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)
- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkrb5support0

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Uncontrolled Recursion. MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17.2 and 1.18.x before 1.18.3 allows unbounded recursion via an ASN.1-encoded Kerberos message because the lib/krb5/asn.1/asn1_encode.c support for BER indefinite lengths lacks a recursion limit.
## Remediation
Upgrade `krb5` to version  or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-28196)
- [CONFIRM](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/57415dda6cf04e73ffc3723be518eddfae599bfd)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20201202-0001/)
- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4795)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/45KKOZQWIIIW5C45PJVGQ32AXBSYNBE7/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/73IGOG6CZAVMVNS4GGRMOLOZ7B6QVA7F/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/KPH2V3WSQTELROZK3GFCPQDOFLKIZ6H5/)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202011-17)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/11/msg00011.html)
vulnerabilities.name: krb5/libkrb5support0

vulnerabilities.title: Reachable Assertion
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.

## References
- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20217)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20217)
- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/5e6d1796106df8ba6bc1973ee0917c170d929086)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20217)

vulnerabilities.title: Cryptographic Issues
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
** DISPUTED ** In Libgcrypt 1.8.4, the C implementation of AES is vulnerable to a flush-and-reload side-channel attack because physical addresses are available to other processes. (The C implementation is used on platforms where an assembly-language implementation is unavailable.) NOTE: the vendor's position is that the issue report cannot be validated because there is no description of an attack.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-12904)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-12904)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/gpg/libgcrypt/commit/a4c561aab1014c3630bc88faf6f5246fee16b020)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/gpg/libgcrypt/commit/daedbbb5541cd8ecda1459d3b843ea4d92788762)
- [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T4541)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-07/msg00049.html)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-12904)

** DISPUTED ** In Libgcrypt 1.8.4, the C implementation of AES is vulnerable to a flush-and-reload side-channel attack because physical addresses are available to other processes. (The C implementation is used on platforms where an assembly-language implementation is unavailable.) NOTE: the vendor's position is that the issue report cannot be validated because there is no description of an attack.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-12904)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-12904)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/gpg/libgcrypt/commit/a4c561aab1014c3630bc88faf6f5246fee16b020)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/gpg/libgcrypt/commit/daedbbb5541cd8ecda1459d3b843ea4d92788762)
- [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T4541)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-07/msg00049.html)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-12904)
vulnerabilities.name: libgcrypt20

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A use-after-free in onig_new_deluxe() in regext.c in Oniguruma 6.9.2 allows attackers to potentially cause information disclosure, denial of service, or possibly code execution by providing a crafted regular expression. The attacker provides a pair of a regex pattern and a string, with a multi-byte encoding that gets handled by onig_new_deluxe(). Oniguruma issues often affect Ruby, as well as common optional libraries for PHP and Rust.

## References
- [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-13224)
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K00103182)

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Oniguruma before 6.9.3 allows Stack Exhaustion in regcomp.c because of recursion in regparse.c.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An integer overflow in the search_in_range function in regexec.c in Oniguruma 6.x before 6.9.4_rc2 leads to an out-of-bounds read, in which the offset of this read is under the control of an attacker. (This only affects the 32-bit compiled version). Remote attackers can cause a denial-of-service or information disclosure, or possibly have unspecified other impact, via a crafted regular expression.

## References
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/12/msg00002.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-19012)

- [MISC](https://github.com/tarantula-team/CVE-2019-19012)
- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4460-1/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-19012)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in Oniguruma 6.x before 6.9.4_rc2. In the function fetch_interval_quantifier (formerly known as fetch_range_quantifier) in regparse.c, PFETCH is called without checking PEND. This leads to a heap-based buffer over-read.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in Oniguruma 6.x before 6.9.4_rc2. In the function gb18030_mbc_enc_len in file gb18030.c, a UChar pointer is dereferenced without checking if it passed the end of the matched string. This leads to a heap-based buffer over-read.

## References

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Management Errors
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
GNU Libtasn1-4.13 libtasn1-4.13 version libtasn1-4.13, libtasn1-4.12 contains a DoS, specifically CPU usage will reach 100% when running asn1Paser against the POC due to an issue in _asn1_expand_object_id(p_tree), after a long time, the program will be killed. This attack appears to be exploitable via parsing a crafted file.

## References
- [CONFIRM](https://gitlab.com/gnutls/libtasn1/issues/4)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-1000654)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-1000654)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-06/msg00009.html)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-06/msg00018.html)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/105151)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-1000654)

vulnerabilities.title: Buffer Overflow
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
LZ4 before 1.9.2 has a heap-based buffer overflow in LZ4_write32 (related to LZ4_compress_destSize), affecting applications that call LZ4_compress_fast with a large input. (This issue can also lead to data corruption.) NOTE: the vendor states "only a few specific / uncommon usages of the API are at risk."

## References

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
A Bleichenbacher type side-channel based padding oracle attack was found in the way nettle handles endian conversion of RSA decrypted PKCS#1 v1.5 data. An attacker who is able to run a process on the same physical core as the victim process, could use this flaw extract plaintext or in some cases downgrade any TLS connections to a vulnerable server.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16869)
- [MISC](http://cat.eyalro.net/)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16869)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106092)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-16869)

vulnerabilities.title: Resource Exhaustion
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Some HTTP/2 implementations are vulnerable to resource loops, potentially leading to a denial of service. The attacker creates multiple request streams and continually shuffles the priority of the streams in a way that causes substantial churn to the priority tree. This can consume excess CPU.

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
Some HTTP/2 implementations are vulnerable to window size manipulation and stream prioritization manipulation, potentially leading to a denial of service. The attacker requests a large amount of data from a specified resource over multiple streams. They manipulate window size and stream priority to force the server to queue the data in 1-byte chunks. Depending on how efficiently this data is queued, this can consume excess CPU, memory, or both.

## References

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to NULL Pointer Dereference. A NULL pointer dereference was found in OpenLDAP server and was fixed in openldap 2.4.55, during a request for renaming RDNs. An unauthenticated attacker could remotely crash the slapd process by sending a specially crafted request, causing a Denial of Service.
## Remediation
Upgrade `openldap` to version  or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-25692)
- [CONFIRM](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1894567)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210108-0006/)
vulnerabilities.name: openldap/libldap-2.4-2

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to NULL Pointer Dereference. The X.509 GeneralName type is a generic type for representing different types of names. One of those name types is known as EDIPartyName. OpenSSL provides a function GENERAL_NAME_cmp which compares different instances of a GENERAL_NAME to see if they are equal or not. This function behaves incorrectly when both GENERAL_NAMEs contain an EDIPARTYNAME. A NULL pointer dereference and a crash may occur leading to a possible denial of service attack. OpenSSL itself uses the GENERAL_NAME_cmp function for two purposes: 1) Comparing CRL distribution point names between an available CRL and a CRL distribution point embedded in an X509 certificate 2) When verifying that a timestamp response token signer matches the timestamp authority name (exposed via the API functions TS_RESP_verify_response and TS_RESP_verify_token) If an attacker can control both items being compared then that attacker could trigger a crash. For example if the attacker can trick a client or server into checking a malicious certificate against a malicious CRL then this may occur. Note that some applications automatically download CRLs based on a URL embedded in a certificate. This checking happens prior to the signatures on the certificate and CRL being verified. OpenSSL's s_server, s_client and verify tools have support for the "-crl_download" option which implements automatic CRL downloading and this attack has been demonstrated to work against those tools. Note that an unrelated bug means that affected versions of OpenSSL cannot parse or construct correct encodings of EDIPARTYNAME. However it is possible to construct a malformed EDIPARTYNAME that OpenSSL's parser will accept and hence trigger this attack. All OpenSSL 1.1.1 and 1.0.2 versions are affected by this issue. Other OpenSSL releases are out of support and have not been checked. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1i (Affected 1.1.1-1.1.1h). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2x (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2w).
## Remediation
Upgrade `openssl` to version  or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1971)
- [CONFIRM](https://git.openssl.org/gitweb/?p=openssl.git;a=commitdiff;h=2154ab83e14ede338d2ede9bbe5cdfce5d5a6c9e)
- [CONFIRM](https://git.openssl.org/gitweb/?p=openssl.git;a=commitdiff;h=f960d81215ebf3f65e03d4d5d857fb9b666d6920)
- [CONFIRM](https://kb.pulsesecure.net/articles/Pulse_Security_Advisories/SA44676)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20201218-0005/)
- [CONFIRM](https://www.openssl.org/news/secadv/20201208.txt)
- [CONFIRM](https://www.tenable.com/security/tns-2020-11)
- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4807)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/DGSI34Y5LQ5RYXN4M2I5ZQT65LFVDOUU/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/PWPSSZNZOBJU2YR6Z4TGHXKYW3YP5QG7/)
- [FREEBSD](https://security.FreeBSD.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-20:33.openssl.asc)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202012-13)
- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2021.html)
- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rbb769f771711fb274e0a4acb1b5911c8aab544a6ac5e8c12d40c5143@%3Ccommits.pulsar.apache.org%3E)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/12/msg00020.html)

## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to NULL Pointer Dereference. The X.509 GeneralName type is a generic type for representing different types of names. One of those name types is known as EDIPartyName. OpenSSL provides a function GENERAL_NAME_cmp which compares different instances of a GENERAL_NAME to see if they are equal or not. This function behaves incorrectly when both GENERAL_NAMEs contain an EDIPARTYNAME. A NULL pointer dereference and a crash may occur leading to a possible denial of service attack. OpenSSL itself uses the GENERAL_NAME_cmp function for two purposes: 1) Comparing CRL distribution point names between an available CRL and a CRL distribution point embedded in an X509 certificate 2) When verifying that a timestamp response token signer matches the timestamp authority name (exposed via the API functions TS_RESP_verify_response and TS_RESP_verify_token) If an attacker can control both items being compared then that attacker could trigger a crash. For example if the attacker can trick a client or server into checking a malicious certificate against a malicious CRL then this may occur. Note that some applications automatically download CRLs based on a URL embedded in a certificate. This checking happens prior to the signatures on the certificate and CRL being verified. OpenSSL's s_server, s_client and verify tools have support for the "-crl_download" option which implements automatic CRL downloading and this attack has been demonstrated to work against those tools. Note that an unrelated bug means that affected versions of OpenSSL cannot parse or construct correct encodings of EDIPARTYNAME. However it is possible to construct a malformed EDIPARTYNAME that OpenSSL's parser will accept and hence trigger this attack. All OpenSSL 1.1.1 and 1.0.2 versions are affected by this issue. Other OpenSSL releases are out of support and have not been checked. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1i (Affected 1.1.1-1.1.1h). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2x (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2w).
## Remediation
Upgrade `openssl` to version  or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-1971)
- [CONFIRM](https://git.openssl.org/gitweb/?p=openssl.git;a=commitdiff;h=2154ab83e14ede338d2ede9bbe5cdfce5d5a6c9e)
- [CONFIRM](https://git.openssl.org/gitweb/?p=openssl.git;a=commitdiff;h=f960d81215ebf3f65e03d4d5d857fb9b666d6920)
- [CONFIRM](https://kb.pulsesecure.net/articles/Pulse_Security_Advisories/SA44676)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20201218-0005/)
- [CONFIRM](https://www.openssl.org/news/secadv/20201208.txt)
- [CONFIRM](https://www.tenable.com/security/tns-2020-11)
- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4807)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/DGSI34Y5LQ5RYXN4M2I5ZQT65LFVDOUU/)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/PWPSSZNZOBJU2YR6Z4TGHXKYW3YP5QG7/)
- [FREEBSD](https://security.FreeBSD.org/advisories/FreeBSD-SA-20:33.openssl.asc)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202012-13)
- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2021.html)
- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rbb769f771711fb274e0a4acb1b5911c8aab544a6ac5e8c12d40c5143@%3Ccommits.pulsar.apache.org%3E)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/12/msg00020.html)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/12/msg00021.html)

vulnerabilities.name: openssl

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Read. An issue was discovered in p11-kit 0.21.1 through 0.23.21. A heap-based buffer over-read has been discovered in the RPC protocol used by thep11-kit server/remote commands and the client library. When the remote entity supplies a byte array through a serialized PKCS#11 function call, the receiving entity may allow the reading of up to 4 bytes of memory past the heap allocation.
## Remediation
Upgrade `p11-kit` to version  or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-29362)
- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4822)
- [MISC](https://github.com/p11-glue/p11-kit/releases)
- [MISC](https://github.com/p11-glue/p11-kit/security/advisories/GHSA-5wpq-43j2-6qwc)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/01/msg00002.html)
vulnerabilities.name: p11-kit/libp11-kit0

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Write. An issue was discovered in p11-kit 0.23.6 through 0.23.21. A heap-based buffer overflow has been discovered in the RPC protocol used by p11-kit server/remote commands and the client library. When the remote entity supplies a serialized byte array in a CK_ATTRIBUTE, the receiving entity may not allocate sufficient length for the buffer to store the deserialized value.
## Remediation
Upgrade `p11-kit` to version  or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-29363)
- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4822)
- [MISC](https://github.com/p11-glue/p11-kit/releases)
- [MISC](https://github.com/p11-glue/p11-kit/security/advisories/GHSA-5j67-fw89-fp6x)
vulnerabilities.name: p11-kit/libp11-kit0

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Integer Overflow or Wraparound. An issue was discovered in p11-kit 0.21.1 through 0.23.21. Multiple integer overflows have been discovered in the array allocations in the p11-kit library and the p11-kit list command, where overflow checks are missing before calling realloc or calloc.
## Remediation
Upgrade `p11-kit` to version  or higher.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-29361)
- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4822)
- [MISC](https://github.com/p11-glue/p11-kit/releases)
- [MISC](https://github.com/p11-glue/p11-kit/security/advisories/GHSA-q4r3-hm6m-mvc2)
- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/01/msg00002.html)

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
In PCRE 8.41, the OP_KETRMAX feature in the match function in pcre_exec.c allows stack exhaustion (uncontrolled recursion) when processing a crafted regular expression.

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-11164)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-11164)
- [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2017/07/11/3)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99575)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-11164)
vulnerabilities.name: pcre3/libpcre3

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Read libpcre in PCRE before 8.43 allows a subject buffer over-read in JIT when UTF is disabled, and \X or \R has more than one fixed quantifier, a related issue to CVE-2019-20454.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `pcre3`.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Write. Perl before 5.30.3 on 32-bit platforms allows a heap-based buffer overflow because nested regular expression quantifiers have an integer overflow. An application written in Perl would only be vulnerable to this flaw if it evaluates regular expressions supplied by the attacker. Evaluating regular expressions in this fashion is known to be dangerous since the regular expression engine does not protect against denial of service attacks in this usage scenario. Additionally, the target system needs a sufficient amount of memory to allocate partial expansions of the nested quantifiers prior to the overflow occurring. This requirement is unlikely to be met on 64bit systems.]
## Remediation
Upgrade `perl` to version  or higher.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://github.com/Perl/perl5/blob/blead/pod/perl5303delta.pod)
- [CONFIRM](https://github.com/perl/perl5/commit/897d1f7fd515b828e4b198d8b8bef76c6faf03ed)
- [CONFIRM](https://github.com/Perl/perl5/compare/v5.30.2...v5.30.3)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200611-0001/)

- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/IN3TTBO5KSGWE5IRIKDJ5JSQRH7ANNXE/)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Integer Overflow or Wraparound. Perl before 5.30.3 has an integer overflow related to mishandling of a "PL_regkind[OP(n)] == NOTHING" situation. A crafted regular expression could lead to malformed bytecode with a possibility of instruction injection. An application written in Perl would only be vulnerable to this flaw if it evaluates regular expressions supplied by the attacker. Evaluating regular expressions in this fashion is known to be dangerous since the regular expression engine does not protect against denial of service attacks in this usage scenario.]
## Remediation
Upgrade `perl` to version  or higher.

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Buffer Overflow regcomp.c in Perl before 5.30.3 allows a buffer overflow via a crafted regular expression because of recursive S_study_chunk calls. An application written in Perl would only be vulnerable to this flaw if it evaluates regular expressions supplied by the attacker. Evaluating regular expressions in this fashion is known to be dangerous since the regular expression engine does not protect against denial of service attacks in this usage scenario.]

vulnerabilities.title: Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU)
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
shadow: TOCTOU (time-of-check time-of-use) race condition when copying and removing directory trees

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2013-4235)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2013-4235)
- [RedHat CVE Database](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2013-4235)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2013-4235)
vulnerabilities.name: shadow/passwd

vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in shadow 4.5. newgidmap (in shadow-utils) is setuid and allows an unprivileged user to be placed in a user namespace where setgroups(2) is permitted. This allows an attacker to remove themselves from a supplementary group, which may allow access to certain filesystem paths if the administrator has used "group blacklisting" (e.g., chmod g-rwx) to restrict access to paths. This flaw effectively reverts a security feature in the kernel (in particular, the /proc/self/setgroups knob) to prevent this sort of privilege escalation.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-7169)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201805-09)
- [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/%2Bsource/shadow/%2Bbug/1729357)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-7169)
vulnerabilities.name: shadow/passwd

vulnerabilities.name: shadow/login

vulnerabilities.title: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
An issue was discovered in shadow 4.5. newgidmap (in shadow-utils) is setuid and allows an unprivileged user to be placed in a user namespace where setgroups(2) is permitted. This allows an attacker to remove themselves from a supplementary group, which may allow access to certain filesystem paths if the administrator has used "group blacklisting" (e.g., chmod g-rwx) to restrict access to paths. This flaw effectively reverts a security feature in the kernel (in particular, the /proc/self/setgroups knob) to prevent this sort of privilege escalation.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-7169)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201805-09)
- [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/%2Bsource/shadow/%2Bbug/1729357)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-7169)
vulnerabilities.name: shadow/login

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Read. An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, macOS Catalina 10.15.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5, iTunes 12.10.7 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.2, iCloud for Windows 7.19. A malicious application may cause a denial of service or potentially disclose memory contents.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `sqlite3`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-9794)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-9794)

- [MISC](https://support.apple.com/HT211178)

vulnerabilities.title: Information Exposure
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
systemd 242 changes the VT1 mode upon a logout, which allows attackers to read cleartext passwords in certain circumstances, such as watching a shutdown, or using Ctrl-Alt-F1 and Ctrl-Alt-F2. This occurs because the KDGKBMODE (aka current keyboard mode) check is mishandled.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20839)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/9725f1a10f80f5e0ae7d9b60547458622aeb322f)
- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/pull/12378)
- [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/%2Bsource/systemd/%2Bbug/1803993)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190530-0002/)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108389)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20839)
vulnerabilities.name: systemd/libsystemd0

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Input Validation systemd through v245 mishandles numerical usernames such as ones composed of decimal digits or 0x followed by hex digits, as demonstrated by use of root privileges when privileges of the 0x0 user account were intended. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-1000082.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `systemd`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-13776)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200611-0003/)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-13776)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/IYGLFEKG45EYBJ7TPQMLWROWPTZBEU63/)
- [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/15985)

vulnerabilities.title: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
GNU Tar through 1.30, when --sparse is used, mishandles file shrinkage during read access, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (infinite read loop in sparse_dump_region in sparse.c) by modifying a file that is supposed to be archived by a different user's process (e.g., a system backup running as root).

## References
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20482)
- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2018/12/msg00023.html)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20482)
- [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201903-05)
- [MISC](http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/tar.git/commit/?id=c15c42ccd1e2377945fd0414eca1a49294bff454)
- [MISC](http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-tar/2018-12/msg00023.html)
- [MISC](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=18745431)
- [MISC](https://twitter.com/thatcks/status/1076166645708668928)
- [MISC](https://utcc.utoronto.ca/~cks/space/blog/sysadmin/TarFindingTruncateBug)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-04/msg00077.html)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106354)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20482)
vulnerabilities.name: tar

vulnerabilities.title: NULL Pointer Dereference
vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
pax_decode_header in sparse.c in GNU Tar before 1.32 had a NULL pointer dereference when parsing certain archives that have malformed extended headers.

## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-9923)

- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-9923)
